title: Death Drums Along the River [1963 - UK] Africa adventure
description:
this movie has a sequel Coast of Skeletons 1965
___________________________________________________________________________________

Death Drums Along the River (1963 - UK, West Germany)              aka Sanders

Adventure

written by . . . . Edgar Wallace
 
http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0057468/


Filmed at South Africa

In an unnamed small British colony on the west coast of Africa two policemen patrolling a wharf sight a sack of peanuts dropped by stevedores. As the sack breaks the workers discover a pouch in it that is quickly grabbed by a man who then runs away. The policemen chase him but he kills one of the officers before disappearing. Police Commissioner Sanders questions Pearson, who is a suspected criminal, but finds no information. At the same time, a Dr. Jung arrives at the airport and is met by Commissioner Sanders' assistant, Inspector Hamilton. Dr. Jung is going to a German-run clinic up country, close to the colony's eastern border. Also on the plane with her is an American journalist who wishes to visit the clinic to do a story, who also turns out to be an old friend of the suspected criminal Pearson. Commissioner Sanders begins to suspect the clinic as a location for smuggled diamonds from across the border.


Video: MPEG4 Video (H264), 672x544, 25.000 fps, 1164 Kbps, 01h19m39s
Audio: Vorbis, 48000 Hz, mono

Display aspect ratio 1.85:1

TVRip with faint corner logo, English audio, no subtitles
